intro: Torenia blancoi, commonly known as the white torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters at the tips of the stems, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Torenia blancoi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
